structure resembling a pinhole camera, organisms that interpose a translucent
medium  between  the  surface  and  the  aperture  through  which  the  light
comes—and so on. By studying this sequence of organisms, they have been
able to explore the transitions through which relatively crude abilities to detect
light were successively refined.**One feature of the story deserves emphasis.
